com.magnet.android.mms.connection

Interface ConnectionService


  • public interface ConnectionService
    Contains the Request and Response interfaces used in communication with the backend.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  ConnectionService.AuthResult
      The possible return values for authenticate.
      static interface  ConnectionService.Request
      The generic request object that encapsulates headers and payload to be sent out to an endpoint.
      static interface  ConnectionService.Response
      The response interface.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean authenticate()
      Deprecated. 
      Replaced by authenitcateWithResult()
      boolean authenticate(boolean isLogout)
      Deprecated. 
      Replaced by authenitcateWithResult() and removeAuthentication()
      ConnectionService.AuthResult authenticateWithResult()
      Similar to the authenticate() authenticate() method, this method returns an result code to allow for more fine-grained error handling.
      void clearSessionId()
      Clears the cached session id for this connection service.
      ConnectionService.Request createRequest()
      Creates an empty request to be executed for this service.
      String getSessionId()
      Retrieves the session id for this connection service.
      void onTokenUpdated(ConnectionConfigManager.AuthHandler.TokenType token)
      Called when setToken() is called on the configuration to notify the service that tokens have beeen updated.
      void removeAuthentication()
      Will clean up the resources used by this ConnectionService and remove any established session.

    • Method Detail

      • authenticate

        boolean authenticate()
                     throws IOException
        Deprecated. Replaced by authenitcateWithResult()
        Invoke the authentication flow for this service. Call this method on a worker thread since it may perform network activity. NOTE: This method does not clear the tokens for this service, because there could be another service that uses the same realm and shares the tokens.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • authenticate

        boolean authenticate(boolean isLogout)
                     throws IOException
        Deprecated. Replaced by authenitcateWithResult() and removeAuthentication()
        Similar to the authenticate() authenticate() method, this method allows the caller to invoke a logout for this service. This should be called on a worker thread as it may perform network activity. NOTE: This does not clear the tokens for this service because there could possibly be another service that uses the same realm and shares the tokens.
        Parameters:
        isLogout - true if the caller wishes to logout for this service; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • authenticateWithResult

        ConnectionService.AuthResult authenticateWithResult()
        Similar to the authenticate() authenticate() method, this method returns an result code to allow for more fine-grained error handling. NOTE: It is good practice to call removeAuthentication() when the notion of the application's "session" should be destroyed and resources can be released.
        Returns:
        A result code to allow for more fine-grained error handling.

      • removeAuthentication

        void removeAuthentication()
        Will clean up the resources used by this ConnectionService and remove any established session. This does NOT clear the tokens. Subsequent requests may once again establish a "session" and consume resources.

      • createRequest

        ConnectionService.Request createRequest()
        Creates an empty request to be executed for this service.
        Returns:
        An empty request to be executed for this service.

      • onTokenUpdated

        void onTokenUpdated(ConnectionConfigManager.AuthHandler.TokenType token)
        Called when setToken() is called on the configuration to notify the service that tokens have beeen updated.
        Parameters:
        token - The token type for this connection configuration (username, password, OAuth token).

      • getSessionId

        String getSessionId()
        Retrieves the session id for this connection service.
        Returns:
        The session id for this connection service.

      • clearSessionId

        void clearSessionId()
        Clears the cached session id for this connection service.
